summary.span: 表示实现 的集合的集合视图。

span.span: Represents the collection view for collections that implement .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 绑定到数据集合时，可能需要对数据进行排序、筛选或分组。When you bind to a data collection, you may want to sort, filter, or group the data. 为此，请使用集合视图。To do that, you use collection views. 您可以将 视为绑定源集合顶部的层，它允许您根据排序、筛选和组查询导航和显示源集合，所有这些操作都无需处理基础源集合本身。You can think of a as the layer on top of the binding source collection that allows you to navigate and display the source collection based on sort, filter, and group queries, all without having to manipulate the underlying source collection itself. 如果源集合实现 接口，则 事件引发的更改会传播到视图。If the source collection implements the interface, the changes raised by the event are propagated to the views. 所有集合都具有默认 。All collections have a default . 对于实现 的所有集合， 对象为默认视图对象。For all collections implementing , the object is the default view object. 是用于实现 的集合的集合视图类。The is the collection view class used for collections that implement . 若要获取默认视图，请使用 方法。To get the default view, you use the method. 有关示例，请参阅[如何：获取数据集合的默认视图](/dotnet/framework/wpf/data/how-to-get-the-default-view-of-a-data-collection)。For an example, see [How to: Get the Default View of a Data Collection](/dotnet/framework/wpf/data/how-to-get-the-default-view-of-a-data-collection). 有关集合视图的详细信息，请参阅[数据绑定概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview)。For more information about collection views, see [Data Binding Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview).

summary.span: 开始添加事务并返回挂起的新项。

span.span: Starts an add transaction and returns the pending new item.
The pending new item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 会启动添加事务。Calling starts an add transaction. 应调用 或 来结束添加事务。You should call or to end the add transaction. 新项始终出现在 "集合" 视图中。A new item always appears in the collection view. 在调用 时，应用于该视图的任何筛选、排序或分组都会应用于新项。Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the view is applied to the new item when is called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 方法会启动添加事务。Calling the method starts an add transaction. 应调用 或 方法来结束添加事务。You should call the or methods to end the add transaction. 新项始终出现在 "集合" 视图中。A new item always appears in the collection view. 在调用 时，应用于该视图的任何筛选、排序或分组都会应用于新项。Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the view is applied to the new item when is called.

span.span: if a new item can be added to the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果没有发生编辑事务，则 可以为集合创建新项; 如果集合不是固定大小，则为; 如果 可以创建正确类型的对象，则为。The can create a new item for the collection if there is no edit transaction occurring, if the collection is not a fixed size, and if the can create an object of the correct type.

span.span: if a specified object can be added to the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `true` 属性，则可以通过调用 方法指定要添加到集合中的对象。If the property is `true`, you can specify an object to add to the collection by calling the method. 如果无法将项添加到集合中，则 `false` 。 is `false` if items cannot be added to the collection.

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示集合视图是否可以放弃挂起的更改并还原所编辑对象的原始值。

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object.

value.span: 如果集合视图可以放弃挂起的更改并还原所编辑对象的原始值，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果编辑的项实现了 接口，则 `true` 。 is `true` if the edited item implements the interface. 如果 `false`，请调用 以使视图退出编辑状态，并提供逻辑来还原所编辑的对象的更改。If is `false`, call to cause the view to exit the edit state and provide logic to revert the changes on the object that was edited.

summary.span: 结束编辑事务，并还原项的原始值（如有可能）。

span.span: Ends the edit transaction, and if possible, restores the original value to the item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将 设置为 `null`，并使集合视图退出编辑状态。 sets to `null` and causes the collection view to exit the edit state. 如果 `true`， 还会还原已编辑对象的原始值。If is `true`, also restores the original values of the edited object.

public: virtual property int Count { int get(); };

summary.span: 获取记录的估计数量。

span.span: Gets the estimated number of records.

value.span: 下列情况之一：

span.span: One of the following:
Value
Meaning
Could not determine the count of the collection.

description.span: 此值可能由“虚拟化”视图返回，这时视图特意不考虑基础集合中的所有项，因为它尝试提高效率，尽量降低整个集合始终都可用这一要求。

span.span: This might be returned by a "virtualizing" view, where the view deliberately does not account for all items in the underlying collection because the view is trying to increase efficiency and minimize dependence on always having the whole collection available.
any other integer
The count of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请注意，此计数表示筛选的计数。Note that this count represents the filtered count.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator

summary.span: 返回可用于枚举视图中的项的对象。

span.span: Returns an object that you can use to enumerate the items in the view.

returns.span: 一个可用于枚举视图中的项的 对象。

span.span: An object that you can use to enumerate the items in the view.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 枚举器实例通常用于对集合的内容进行异步检查，在这种情况下，还用于对视图内容进行异步检查。Enumerator instances are typically used for making asynchronous checks of the contents of a collection, or in this case, the contents of the view. 例如，如果要对视图的内容开始 `foreach` 迭代，最好获取一个异步复制，以确保视图项的长度在循环中间不会发生意外更改。For example, if you are about to start a `foreach` iteration over the contents of the view, it may be better to obtain an asynchronous copy to ensure that the length of the view items does not change unexpectedly midway through the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 仅可通过访问集合对象并使用它的各种方法（如 `Add`）来设置此属性。This property can only be set by accessing the collection object and using its various methods such as `Add`. 用于访问集合对象本身的属性是只读的;集合本身是可读/写的。The property to access the collection object itself is read-only; the collection itself is read/write. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此属性：The following example shows how to use this property: [!code-csharp[DataBindingLab#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/CSharp/MainWindow.xaml.cs#6)] [!code-vb[DataBindingLab#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/VisualBasic/MainWindow.xaml.vb#6)] 有关完整示例，请参阅[数据绑定演示](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=163703)。For the complete example, see [Data Binding Demo](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=163703).

value.span: 如果项列表已处于可以进行分组的正确顺序，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将此属性设置为 `true` 会通知视图：项列表已经按正确的顺序进行分组，并允许视图使用更有效的算法来生成组。Setting this property to `true` informs the view that the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping and allows the view to use a more efficient algorithm to build the groups. 如果是以下情况，数据的顺序是正确的：The data is in the correct order if: 1. 属于给定组的所有项会连续出现，All items belonging to a given group appear consecutively, and 2. 如果 集合非空，则 中的组将出现在任何其他组之前，并按 中的相同顺序显示。If the collection is non-empty, the groups in appear before any other groups, and in the same order as in .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `index` 相对于集合视图，而不是集合。`index` is relative to the collection view, not the collection. 例如，如果集合包含10个项，而视图有 以便显示7个项，则 `index` 的有效值为0到6。For example, if the collection has 10 items and the view has a so that 7 items appear, the valid values of `index` are 0 through 6.
